title: refactor: config cleanup
body:
remove redundant config get, require all config (fail on invalid), add defaults, enforce valid values

# 📦 Pull Request

## Summary

This PR removes duplicate config creation functions, sets default values on the config using serde_default (if they don't exist - don't need to be created manually), and enforces values present in json (so it errors out if invalid values are present). 
It also removes the redundant `get()` config function, so everything is underneath the `get_or_create` which then calls `create` if the file doesn't exist.
It also adds `Regex` fields to the config:
```
   comment_exclude_regex: None,
            task_exclude_regex: None,
```
However, no additional code related to these is implemented yet and that will be added as a feature later.

Refactors config to remove duplicate get (now just a single get_or_create). 

Confirmed it no longer deletes config (goes straight into new config) if a file already exists - it only calls create if config does not exist.

Also corrects list_import test case which broke as some of this work and needed tob e updated to match code.

In addition, see comment on #1301 regarding function architecture going forward for errors :

title: chore: Automate CI Workflow
body:
This workflow does the following changes:

For releases:
Adds "release-please" which will automatically open a PR when changes are pushed to main.
Release_check will run on releases opened by release-please, and once all are passing and merged the version tag is created.
At that point the build_macos (And other build scripts) will run and upload the files to the new release created by release-please.

For CI:
Checks now run using swatinem/rust-cache and complete in ~30-40 seconds for pushes. Full checks (including codecov) are run on any PRs.

title: feat: oauth auth login command
body:
What I have implemented here is the `auth login` command, that results in updating `token` in the config file if it succeeds.

Based on the documentation it looks like the token never expires, so we can use it in the same manner that we used the developer token.

In my next PR I am going to have the user choose whether to log in with OAuth or a developer token. I'm splitting it out because right now `auth login` requires a config to be present, but for initial run there will not be a config yet.

title: ci: automate Build Compilations and Generation
body:
This commit contains automated Github Actions code which does the following:

1) On push and commit `ci.yml` test cases are run (as normal)
2) On PRs (only), it runs `pr_tests.yml`
3) If  (and only if) "Full Platform Tests" on 'pr_tests.yml' passes, AND if the PR is tagged with a version number (i.e. v1.2.3), `release_macos.yml` will automatically run, which cross-compiles on latest-macos for both Intel and Silicon (ARM).

4) The release is hashed and automatically uploaded as an asset to the repository (using the TOD_CONTENTS_RED_WRITE PAT token and the [softprops/release](https://github.com/softprops/action-gh-release)) workflow, tagged with the version number. 

Things that do need to be done (not right away but before this process will fully work :))
1) MacOS Intel & Arm are generated, and the filenames are slightly different (links need to be updated)
2) Homebrew script needs to be updated to point to the new binaries (manual for now, to be automated later - first need to get the script updated to handle architecture and hashes)
3) Release.sh needs to be updated to follow the new process (if it's going to continue to be used).

Things not yet implemented, but need to be added later.
5) homebrew-tod automatic updates (I think this is probably best handled with a dependency monitor in Tod, but could also be handled with an additional CI step that uploads with the same token 
6) Release notes are not automatically generated. Ideally, the should come from a submitted MD file or automatically summarized. (however, If they are submitted as part of the PR, they would be included.)
7) release.sh needs to be updated to follow the new process as well
8) Only Macos (Arm & Intel) are currently generated; need to follow similar format with release_macos to generate additional scripts. 
9) Currently the full compiled folder is included - need to update the tar.gz script to only compress the specific file (`tod`) and not the full folder.

----

This will likely need to be force committed due to additional updates below:

- Updated rust toolchains to current toolchain
- Removed redundant/unnecessary additional rust steps (such as installation of cargo on the simple FIXME lint check)
- Removed `release.yaml` , replaced with platform-specific files (can add it back in with the various platform builds needed)

v3.4.0

⚠️ Important Changes

The cache backend service has been rewritten from the ground up for improved performance and reliability. actions/cache now integrates with the new cache service (v2) APIs.

The new service will gradually roll out as of February 1st, 2025. The legacy service will also be sunset on the same date. Changes in these release are fully backward compatible.

We are deprecating some versions of this action. We recommend upgrading to version v4 or v3 as soon as possible before February 1st, 2025. (Upgrade instructions below).

If you are using pinned SHAs, please use the SHAs of versions v4.2.0 or v3.4.0

If you do not upgrade, all workflow runs using any of the deprecated actions/cache will fail.

Upgrading to the recommended versions will not break your workflows.

body:
Bumps [reqwest](https://github.com/seanmonstar/reqwest) from 0.12.15 to 0.12.16.
Release notes

Sourced from reqwest's releases.

v0.12.16

Highlights

  • Add ClientBuilder::http3_congestion_bbr() to enable BBR congestion control.
  • Add ClientBuilder::http3_send_grease() to configure whether to send use QUIC grease.
  • Add ClientBuilder::http3_max_field_section_size() to configure the maximum response headers.
  • Add ClientBuilder::tcp_keepalive_interval() to configure TCP probe interval.
  • Add ClientBuilder::tcp_keepalive_retries() to configure TCP probe count.
  • Add Proxy::headers() to add extra headers that should be sent to a proxy.
  • Fix redirect::Policy::limit() which had an off-by-1 error, allowing 1 more redirect than specified.
  • Fix HTTP/3 to support streaming request bodies.
  • (wasm) Fix null bodies when calling Response::bytes_stream().

What's Changed

  • Clarify that Response::content_length() is not derived from a Content-Length header in docs by @​babolivier in seanmonstar/reqwest#2588
  • docs: link to char::REPLACEMENT_CHARACTER by @​marcospb19 in seanmonstar/reqwest#1880
  • feat: add H3 client config support by @​smalls0098 in seanmonstar/reqwest#2609
  • chore: update brotli to v7 by @​nyurik in seanmonstar/reqwest#2620
  • Do not pull in an entirely different DEFLATE implementation just for tests by @​Shnatsel in seanmonstar/reqwest#2625
  • chore: fix some typos in comment by @​xixishidibei in seanmonstar/reqwest#2628
  • fix(wasm): handle null body in bytes_stream by @​alongubkin in seanmonstar/reqwest#2632
  • ClientBuilder::interface on macOS/Solarish OSes by @​hawkw in seanmonstar/reqwest#2623

  • refactor: remove futures-util unless using stream/multipart/compression/blocking by @​paolobarbolini in seanmonstar/reqwest#2692
  • chore: replace rustls-pemfile with rustls-pki-types by @​tottoto in seanmonstar/reqwest#2541
  • Ensure H3ResponseFuture Implements Sync by @​ducaale in seanmonstar/reqwest#2685
  • feat(redirect): Using FollowRedirect from tower-http to handle the redirect loop by @​linyihai in seanmonstar/reqwest#2617
  • feat: add customizable headers in proxy mode by @​chanbengz in seanmonstar/reqwest#2600
  • Prepare v0.12.16 by @​seanmonstar in seanmonstar/reqwest#2694

New Contributors

  • @​marcospb19 made their first contribution in seanmonstar/reqwest#1880
  • @​smalls0098 made their first contribution in seanmonstar/reqwest#2609
  • @​Shnatsel made their first contribution in seanmonstar/reqwest#2625
  • @​xixishidibei made their first contribution in seanmonstar/reqwest#2628
  • @​alongubkin made their first contribution in seanmonstar/reqwest#2632

  • Add ClientBuilder::http3_send_grease() to configure whether to send use QUIC grease.
  • Add ClientBuilder::http3_max_field_section_size() to configure the maximum response headers.

  • Fix HTTP/3 to support streaming request bodies.

title: Fixing test case failures, handle blank token value in config, add TZ output
body:
I'm trying to figure out why the test_deadline_value tests are failing, when they were passing earlier.

- Was there a change in Chrono/tz dependencies?
- Am I simply dealing with time-of-day drift issues? (Do we need to standardize tests to run in UTC or similar?)
- Was there a change in the defaults? I was running with my local tod.cfg different from defaults.
